message_1: A sample of carbon-14 has an initial activity of 800 Bq. What is the activity of the sample after 5000 years if the half-life of carbon-14 is 5730 years?
message_2:
To calculate the activity of the sample after 5000 years, we can use the radioactive decay formula:

A = A0 * (1/2)^(t/T)

where:
A = activity after time t
A0 = initial activity (800 Bq)
t = time elapsed (5000 years)
T = half-life of carbon-14 (5730 years)

A = 800 * (1/2)^(5000/5730)

A ≈ 800 * (1/2)^0.872

A ≈ 800 * 0.543

A ≈ 434.4 Bq

The activity of the sample after 5000 years is approximately 434.4 Bq.
